definition: a learned person need not leave his home to know what's going on in the world (idiom)
pinyin: xiu4 cai5 bu4 chu1 men2 , quan2 zhi1 tian1 xia4 shi4
containing_words.word: 秀才不出门，全知天下事

sentences.english: In the midst of this, a sudden sense of omniscience dawned on me.
sentences.chinese: 在这个时候，我忽然有了一种全知的感觉。

sentences.english: Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.
sentences.chinese: 神为大，我们不能全知，他的年数不能测度。
神学上的术语就是“全知”。

sentences.english: The prospect of offending three such omniscient beings made me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 要冒犯三个这般的全知存在，那前景让我神经兮兮。

sentences.english: Where the mind is all quiet, there is all knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 头脑彻底安静的地方，就是全知的所在。

sentences.english: Gods are neither omniscient nor omnipotent.
Your all-knowing Inner Voice will tell you many things if you will do this.
sentences.chinese: 若你照做，你全知的内涵声响将告诉你很多事情。

sentences.english: There is not a good deed which ye do, but Allah is well-acquainted therewith .
sentences.chinese: 无论你们所行的是什么善事，真主确是全知的。

sentences.english: History is the best antidote to delusions of omnipotence and omniscience.
sentences.chinese: 历史是对于全能全知幻觉最好的解毒药。

sentences.english: He created all things, and He hath full knowledge of all things.
sentences.chinese: 他曾创造万物，他是全知万的。

definition: Holy Father/God the Father (in the Christian Trinity)
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
feudal term of praise for ruler, king or emperor/general term for saint in former times/term for God during the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom 太平天國|太平天国/Holy Spirit (in Christian Trinity)
